intro: Pentanema helveticum, commonly known as the Swiss mountain heath, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or acidic soils at high altitudes, where it forms dense mats or shrubs. Its leaves are evergreen, needle-like, and adapted to withstand cold temperatures and strong winds. Pentanema helveticum plays an important ecological role in stabilizing alpine soil and providing habitat for specialized invertebrates.
